title: Carol's Arroz Con Pollo Recipe
description: Arroz con pollo is a colorful one-pot chicken and rice dish with layers of flavor thanks to the addition of bell pepper, paprika, saffron, and tomatoes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Arroz Con Pollo (Chicken and Rice) 4.4 (373) 277 Reviews 24 Photos This arroz con pollo is an easy chicken and seasoned rice dish that's comforting and delicious. Easy to adjust to use chicken thighs, or leftover chicken. Submitted by Carol Alter Updated on April 6, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 24 24 24 24 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1-inch pieces ½ teaspoon salt, divided ½ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided ½ teaspoon paprika, divided 3 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 green bell pepper, chopped ¾ cup chopped onion 1 ½ teaspoons minced garlic 1 cup long-grain white rice 1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes ½ cup white wine ⅛ teaspoon saffron 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley Directions Season chicken with a 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon paprika. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add seasoned chicken; cook and stir until no longer pink in the center and golden brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer chicken onto a plate; set aside. Add green pepper, onions, and garlic to the same skillet; cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add rice; cook and stir until rice is opaque, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in broth, tomatoes, white wine, and saffron. Stir in remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon paprika; bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes. Add chicken and stir until heated through. Stir in parsley and serve. I Made It Print 433 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 471 Calories 14g Fat 50g Carbs 30g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 471 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 2g 12% Cholesterol 69mg 23% Sodium 1015mg 44% Total Carbohydrate 50g 18% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 6g Protein 30g 60% Vitamin C 36mg 40% Calcium 77mg 6% Iron 5mg 26% Potassium 603mg 13% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Arroz Con Pollo (Chicken and Rice) 01 of 24 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 24 Photo by  SpryRice3525 03/27/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Easy to follow Great flavors I’m going to add a little more seasoning and less wine. It was a little bland for our taste but good all the same. 03 of 24 Photo by  Tony Bell 08/05/2020 04 of 24 Photo by  Robert N Steinberg 07/22/2020 I did add sliced black olives. The tang was a nice addition, and added some visual contrast. I’ll definitely make this again. Chicken tenders were on sale, so that’s what I used. 05 of 24 Photo by  Eric Theeck 10/11/2019 Pretty tasty for first run. I used 1 1/2 lb chicken. Doubled the garlic and paprika. Skipped the wine. I used a white queso cheese on top which made all the difference. I cooked with the tomatoes but took them out as I don’t care much for them. I will definitely make this again. Cast iron of corse. 06 of 24 Photo by  jpickens 10/07/2019 I liked this recipe. I didn't have saffron but it still came out pretty tasty. I added a bit of mixed vegetables for a full meal. Next time I'm going to add just a tad bit of tomato sauce "para color," as my mother says. 07 of 24 Photo by  Stuart Wells 09/20/2018 08 of 24 Photo by  Gabi Levine 05/24/2016 09 of 24 Photo by  Kaycee 05/17/2016 10 of 24 Photo by  Rock_lobster 08/24/2015 Carol's Arroz con Pollo Haiku: "Warmed saffron in broth, but did the rest as written. We loved this, Carol!" Delicious meal that reminded me of paella, but not as labor, or ingredient, intensive. I don't really have any arroz con pollo experience to compare this to, so whether it's authentic or not, I can't agree or disagree w/ many of the reviews, but I thought it was terrific. But other than it needing a bit of salt (and my warming the saffron in the chicken broth separately), I was faithful to the recipe and loved every bite. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Chickpea Curry 647 Ratings Rice Cooker Crawfish Tails 19 Ratings Vegetarian Mexican Rice 252 Ratings Meatballs Mexicana and Rice 8 Ratings Mexican Tomato Rice 227 Ratings Chicken Fried Steak Cuban Style 58 Ratings Moroccan Chicken 365 Ratings Spanish Rice II 1,867 Ratings Garlic Chicken And Grapes 112 Ratings Vegan Bean Taco Filling 434 Ratings Chicken Chimichangas 275 Ratings Sarah's Easy Shredded Chicken Taco Filling 133 Ratings Jay's Jerk Chicken 734 Ratings Refried Beans Without the Refry 2,604 Ratings Aloo Matar 151 Ratings Vegan Spanish Rice 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Carol Alter
instructions: Season chicken with a 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon paprika.;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add seasoned chicken; cook and stir until no longer pink in the center and golden brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer chicken onto a plate; set aside.;Add green pepper, onions, and garlic to the same skillet; cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add rice; cook and stir until rice is opaque, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in broth, tomatoes, white wine, and saffron. Stir in remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon paprika; bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.;Add chicken and stir until heated through. Stir in parsley and serve.
